conditions.short_description: Wind slabs could be present high in mountains, especially in the north. Snow should gain strength in mild weather and little precipitation in the coming days.
conditions.full_description: Wind slabs could be present high in mountains, especially in the north. Snow should gain strength in mild weather and little precipitation in the coming days.

area_forecast.forecast: Snow has settled and gained strength in warm weather.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: On Tuesday 11.3., two avalanches were observed in Botssúlur. Time of release is unknown. Small natural slab avalanches fell last week in NW-facing gullies in Bláfjöll.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow was added in early March in southerly winds and snow showers. Thin wind slabs formed on north-facing slopes. They have settled and subsided in warm weather, snow is now widely isothermal. Beneath is old hardpacked snow. Continuing dry and mild weather is expected in the coming days, so the snow should continue to settle and strengthen over time.
area_forecast.weather: Lítilsháttar úrkoma. Dægursveiflur í hita, yfir frostmarki á daginn, mögulega næturfrost til fjalla. Vestlægur vindur, snýst í suðlægan á laugardag.

area_forecast.forecast: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Sunday and is now generally isothermal. It should continue to strengthen in mild weather and little precipitation.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: Several loose avalanches fell in Ytri-Kirkjubólshlíð in Skutulsfjörður on Monday 10.3. Small loose avalanches also released in the area last week, in sunshine.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow added in the beginning of March and wind slabs formed in various aspects. Before, there was rather little snow in the area, with old hardpacked snow in mountains. Since Sunday 9.3., temperatures have been above freezing and snow has settled and subsided. Several avalanches fell in the area on Monday. Mild weather with little precipitation is expected in the coming days, so the snow should continue to settle and strengthen over time.
area_forecast.weather: SV átt og lítilsháttar úrkoma. Milt veður, með dægursveiflum og næturfrosti til fjalla.

area_forecast.forecast: A skier triggered a slab avalanche in Ólafsfjörður 11.3. Warm and sunny weather but persistent slab in high elevations. Small sluffs have released in S-SE facing aspected due to the sun, sluffs possible in steep terrain.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: A skier triggerd a small slab avalache in Skeggjabrekkudalur in Ólafsfjörður on 11.3 and a small slab avalanche released there 10.3. Small sluffs have released in S-SE facing aspects widely in the forecast area. An avalanche released in Krossafjall on March 4th.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Some softer snow or old wind slab can still be found on top of firn in high elevations. Sunny and warm weather in the last days and small wet avalanche activity in the area. Cornice collapse or small sluffs could release in steep terrain due to solar radiation and mild temperatures.
area_forecast.weather: Suðlægar áttir næstu daga og þurrt. Fremur hlýtt í veðri og talsverð dægursveifla í hita.

area_forecast.forecast: Little or no snow is at low elevations and hard packed snow is in the mountains. Some slabs might persist in places.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Little or no snow is at low elevations and hard packed snow is in the mountains. Small slabs could persist in places in high elevations.
area_forecast.weather: Fremur hæg vestlæg eða breytileg átt á föstudag og laugardag en suðlægari á sunnudag. Þurrt að mestur og milt veður, talsverð dægursveifla í hita

weather_forecast.forecast: Little precipitation in the next few days. Daily fluctuations in temperature, with nighttime freezing in mountains.
